else

}

item.title: Is this a correct code? [PICS]
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“warlok, post:8, topic:313016”]Alright, I’ll repost the code using correct conventions.

public boolean inClanPk() { if ((coordY >= 3225) && (coordY <= 3239) && (coordX <= 3238) && (coordX >= 3225)) { return true; } else { return false; } }[/quote]

when you do [code], add =java, so it would be [code=java]

it is alot easier to read. [/code][/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a correct code? [PICS]
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:3, topic:313016”][quote author=warlok link=topic=409529.msg3021849#msg3021849 date=1257638864]
public boolean inClanPk() {
if ((coordY >= 3225) && (coordY <= 3239) && (coordX <= 3238) && (coordX >= 3225)) {
return true;
} else {
return false;
}
}

That’d be the correct code.
[/quote]
that isn’t necessarily true… u dont have to have a } for { all you need is a form of code that is a return to mark your return bracket ( { ) eg. return 240; after that bracket or after a command

for every bracket “(” you need “)”,
for every bracket “{” you need “}”
in the code.[/quote]

Read full topic

Alright, I’ll repost the code using correct conventions.

public boolean inClanPk() { if ((coordY >= 3225) && (coordY <= 3239) && (coordX <= 3238) && (coordX >= 3225)) { return true; } else { return false; } }

item.title: Is this a correct code? [PICS]
item.dc:creator: @lmfaoown lmfaoown
item.description:
@lmfaoown wrote:

Is this a correct code?

public boolean inClanPk() {
if ((coordY >= 3225) && (coordY <= 3239) && (coordX <= 3238) && (coordX >= 3225)
return true;
else
return false;
}

I followed this topic to make a fun pk zone “http://www.google.org/showthread.php?t=112982” And i get this error

Once i changed it to

public boolean inClanPk() {
    if ((coordY >= 3225) && (coordY <= 3239) && (coordX <= 3238) && (coordX >= 3225)) {
        return true;
            } else {
        return false;
    }
}

i got this…
